title: Liam Williams is verging on greatness, but he admits Wales need 80-minute displays to gain World Cup success
text:
A hundred England fans are due to check into the Wales team hotel but they will probably bother Liam Williams less than the dozen reporters waiting to speak to him about the World Cup quarter-final with France.

“F------ hell, that’s a lot,” Williams said when he saw how many were in the media huddle. Wales’ extravagantly bandy full-back dislikes big audiences but they will only grow larger if the Six Nations champions fulfil their promise in Japan. At 28, Williams could be on the verge of attaining greatness in one of Welsh rugby’s most hallowed roles: that of audacious last-line counter-attacker....
description: A hundred England fans are due to check into the Wales team hotel but they will probably bother Liam Williams less than the dozen reporters waiting to speak to him about the World Cup quarter-final with France.
